results.title: Longing for belonging
results.creator_credit: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jane Harrison’s search for belonging is a road trip with a lot of potholes along the way. Of mixed descent, she has longed to connect with her Indigenous heritage, which has forced her to confront some issues and attitudes within Australian society today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jane Harrison, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2009)
results.brief_description: Seven members of the general public participate in ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. Through the life changing events and tributes to family members, resonates a search for identity and a sense of home.

results.title: May's story
results.creator_credit: Sue Freeth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1895, at the age of 24, May sailed to Japan and dedicated her life to caring for the children in the villages. Sue Freeth, with the help of some of May’s ex-students, traces the path walked by May, and in doing so comes closer to understanding the life of this amazing woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Freeth, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Supreme Sound Studios, Les Bambury and Fremantle Port Authority

results.title: Explosives: the two metre lifeline
results.creator_credit: David Plummer, Donald Crombie, Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
In this 1974 film, the use of comedy and narrative drama are employed to demonstrate the correct handling of explosives and detonators. Produced by the South Australian Film Corporation for the South Australian Mines Department, the film shows three people who handle explosives in the course of an ordinary day: a farmer removing tree stumps from his paddock, an opal miner in Coober Pedy and a ‘powder monkey’ on a road construction crew.

Introduced by a stereotypical ‘Aussie bloke’ drinking a beer at the pub, the film follows the three protagonists through their separate stories, as the narrator points out the mistakes and correct methods in their techniques. Demonstrating a casual, light-hearted approach to safety instruction, this film is a humorous presentation filled with expletives and colloquial terms, aimed to speak to workers on their level.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Expand my boundaries
results.creator_credit: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When she was given the opportunity to study in Melbourne, Denise VanWyk and her family seized it with both hands. She marvels at her new home, its diversity, acceptance and relaxed atmosphere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise VanWyk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Bus people
results.creator_credit: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When you’re poor, there’s nothing as important as finding food. Nicole Bloom movingly recalls her distressing time on the streets, amongst the poor people of Melbourne, when riding on the bus is a luxury.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicole Bloom, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Exploring our solar system
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This video explores the Milky Way from the center to its outer limits using computer enhanced footage from NASA and specially commissioned animation based on information obtained during Voyager 2’s flyby of Neptune in 1989. Beginning with the Sun, each of the main features of the planets is described, including the earth and our moon. A description of the ways in which the solar system is investigated, including telescopes and manned and unmanned space travel is also included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: Exploring the heart and mind
results.creator_credit: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program discusses the Expressionist and Surrealist artists who sought to reveal deep feelings and subconscious thoughts in their painting. It includes work by Rousseau, Redon, Rouault, Matisse, Nolde, Kirchner, Kandinski and others.
